newsitem.title: USA: Boston wants to charge fees for newsboxes - report.
newsitem.headline: Boston wants to charge fees for newsboxes - report.

text.p: Boston Mayor Thomas Menino filed legislation that would regulate newsboxes in the city and force publishers to pay fees to keep the boxes on the street, according to published reports Wednesday.
Under the proposed law, newspaper publishers would be charged a $150 application fee, plus a $15 annual maintenance fee for each newsbox, The Boston Globe and The Boston Herald reported.
No estimates on the amount of revenues were immediately available and a spokesman for Menino could not be immediately reached. There are, however, hundreds of newsboxes sprinkled throughout Boston.
